question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
Let

\begin{align*}\displaystyle f : A \to B\end{align*} be a function and let

\begin{align*}C \subseteq A\end{align*} and $D \subseteq B$. Define the sets

\begin{align*}\displaystyle f^{-1} (D)\end{align*} and $\displaystyle f (C)$.
hints:
Recall that

\begin{align*}\displaystyle f^{-1}(D)\end{align*}

is the pre-image of the set $D$, that is the set containing all the
elements that are mapped by $f$ into the set $D$ and that

\begin{align*}\displaystyle f(C)\end{align*}

is the image of the set $C$, that is the set all the images of elements
of the set $C$.
